title: ImportError. Library not loaded: libirc.dylib
body_html:
I'm trying to install PyTorch from GitHub to access the new distributions and differentiable determinant function.

  • OS: macOS 10.13.3
  • PyTorch version: latest GitHub clone
  • How you installed PyTorch (conda, pip, source): source
  • Python version: 3.6.4 (Anaconda)
  • CUDA/cuDNN version: N/A
  • GPU models and configuration: None
  • GCC version (if compiling from source): Apple LLVM version 9.0.0
export CMAKE_PREFIX_PATH=~/anaconda3
conda install numpy pyyaml setuptools cmake cffi typing
git clone --recursive https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch
cd pytorch
MACOSX_DEPLOYMENT_TARGET=10.9 CC=clang CXX=clang++ python setup.py install
cd ..

Then in IPython:

import torch as th

I get the error message:

---------------------------------------------------------------------------
ImportError                               Traceback (most recent call last)
<ipython-input-1-eb42ca6e4af3> in <module>()
----> 1 import torch

~/anaconda3/lib/python3.6/site-packages/torch/__init__.py in <module>()
     76     pass
     77 
---> 78 from torch._C import *
     79 
     80 __all__ += [name for name in dir(_C)

ImportError: dlopen(/Users/Arya/anaconda3/lib/python3.6/site-packages/torch/_C.cpython-36m-darwin.so, 9): Library not loaded: libirc.dylib
  Referenced from: /Users/Arya/anaconda3/lib/python3.6/site-packages/torch/lib/libATen.dylib
  Reason: image not found

Installing 0.3.1 from conda, on the other hand, works fine—but without access to the new features.

body:
I'm trying to install PyTorch from GitHub to access the new distributions and differentiable determinant function.

- OS: macOS 10.13.3
- PyTorch version: latest GitHub clone
- How you installed PyTorch (conda, pip, source): source
- Python version: 3.6.4 (Anaconda)
- CUDA/cuDNN version: N/A
- GPU models and configuration: None
- GCC version (if compiling from source): Apple LLVM version 9.0.0

```bash 
export CMAKE_PREFIX_PATH=~/anaconda3
conda install numpy pyyaml setuptools cmake cffi typing
git clone --recursive https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch
cd pytorch
MACOSX_DEPLOYMENT_TARGET=10.9 CC=clang CXX=clang++ python setup.py install
cd ..
```

Then in IPython:
```python
import torch as th
```

I get the error message:
```python
---------------------------------------------------------------------------
ImportError                               Traceback (most recent call last)
<ipython-input-1-eb42ca6e4af3> in <module>()
----> 1 import torch

~/anaconda3/lib/python3.6/site-packages/torch/__init__.py in <module>()
     76     pass
     77 
---> 78 from torch._C import *
     79 
     80 __all__ += [name for name in dir(_C)

ImportError: dlopen(/Users/Arya/anaconda3/lib/python3.6/site-packages/torch/_C.cpython-36m-darwin.so, 9): Library not loaded: libirc.dylib
  Referenced from: /Users/Arya/anaconda3/lib/python3.6/site-packages/torch/lib/libATen.dylib
  Reason: image not found
```

Installing 0.3.1 from conda, on the other hand, works fine—but without access to the new features.
